title: 26 RTI activists blacklisted, says H.K. Patil
content: The activists have been “blackmailing” officials and elected representatives and delaying public work, allege Opposition MLAs

title: Six arrested on charge of drug peddling in Bengaluru; drugs worth ₹61 lakh recovered
content: The North division police arrested a group of six persons, including three Engineering graduates, and recovered drugs worth ₹61 lakh from them. The police have seized 6.2 kg of ganja, 270 g of MDMA, 75 g of charas, three mobile phones, and ₹69,100 in cash from them

title: Ward delimitation exercise in Kerala local bodies completed: State Delimitation Commission
content: Commission hears all petitioners, scrutinises all complaints and objections before wrapping up the exercise

title: Parliament passes National Sports Bill after extensive discussion
content: The National Anti-Doping (Amendment) Bill, which reinforces NADA's autonomy as required by the World Anti-Doping Agency, was also passed by the Parliament

title: YSRCP demands action against TDP over electoral malpractices in Pulivendula, Ontimitta ZPTC  byelections
content: The party leaders accuse TDP and police of obstructing voters, intimidating staff, and enabling fraudulent voting during the bypolls

title: Man held on charge of stealing phones in Bengaluru; police recover 80 phones from him
content: Following a mobile phone snatching case reported a few days ago, the Mahadevapura police arrested a 24-year-old man and recovered 80 mobile phones worth ₹20 lakh from him

title: Tirupati MP urges Centre to save aquaculture farmers
content: Maddila Gurumoorthy seeks the Union government to allocate funds for setting up cold storage facilities and to provide alternative international export markets to protect the farmers

title: Out of ₹120 crore agreed, Embassy Group paid only ₹1 crore for metro station: Shivakumar
content: Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar on Tuesday told the Legislative Assembly that the Embassy Group paid only ₹1 crore against the agreed ₹120 crore for the construction of a metro station of Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Ltd. at Bettadahalasur in the city under Phase 2A and 2B

title: Manager of private firm arrested for stealing valuables from company in Bengaluru
content: The Jayanagar police arrested a 40-year-old manager of a private firm and recovered 1.4 kg of gold valuables and 1 kg of silver articles worth ₹89.09 lakh, which he had allegedly stolen from his office in the last few years

title: CCB unearths illegal telephone exchange racket being operated from data centre in Whitefield
content: A mobile service provider led the Central Crime Branch officials to unearth another illegal international telephone exchange racket being operated from a data centre in Whitefield

title: Another wildlife smuggling racket busted at Bengaluru airport
content: Customs officials on August 11 caught a 20-year-old passenger allegedly trying to smuggle 40 wild animals and reptiles concealed in his check-in bag into Bengaluru from Bangkok

title: Madras High Court rejects plea to permit only Vaishnavite Brahmins to run prasadam stall at Devarajaswamy Temple
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh dismisses a writ petition filed by a 71-year-old devotee residing at West Mambalam in Chennai

title: Personalised care plan for children who lost parents to Wayanad landslides
content: The Department of Social Work of Rajagiri College of Social Sciences prepared a report, based on which the WCD department, in association with UNICEF, has come up with a scheme to support the rehabilitation of 25 children.

title: Is a ‘potentiality of abuse’ of BNS Section 152 a ground to declare the law unconstitutional, asks the Supreme Court
content: Media persons typically become entangled written or aired content, matters that don’t require custodial interrogation, the SC said; the court said it was balancing journalists’ right to speech against the state’s right to maintain public order

title: Vijayawada Police Commissioner inspects security arrangements ahead of launch of free bus travel for women
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu will launch ‘Free Bus Service for Women’ in the State, at Pandit Nehru Bus Station in Vijayawada on Independence Day.

title: Expert panel has recommended that India doesn't fall within criteria for adopting malaria vaccines: Govt
content: Minister of State for Health Anupriya Patel was responding to a question on whether India's first malaria vaccine has received regulatory approval for use in the country

title: E20 Petrol Leads To Better Acceleration, Ride Quality: Centre Amid Backlash
content: Amid a backlash over the introduction of 20% ethanol-blended petrol (E20), the Centre on Tuesday not only emphasised that the move will help reduce pollution, but also said that the formulation leads to better acceleration and even ride quality.

title: Pulling Woman's Hand Not Offence If Criminal Intent Not Proven: High Court
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court has acquitted a man convicted in 2018 for allegedly molesting a mentally challenged woman.

title: Telangana Tops 'Notorious' National List With Highest Cyber Crimes
content: Cyber crooks seem to be most active in southern India, with two states - Telangana and Karnataka - recording the highest rate of such crimes, showed National Crime Records Bureau data.

title: "Drastic": Karti Chidambaram Questions If Stray Dog Order Can Be Implemented
content: The Supreme Court order to send stray dogs to special shelters will be difficult to implement because there is neither funds allocation nor manpower to round up the strays, Congress's Karti Chidambaram told NDTV today.

title: Top Court Bars Action Against Owners Of End-Of-Life Vehicles In Delhi-NCR
content: In a major relief for car owners in Delhi and the National Capital Region (NCR), the Supreme Court has said that no coercive actions will be taken against those who own diesel vehicles older than 10 years and petrol vehicles older than 15 years.

title: 10 Lakh Stray Dogs, Barely Any Shelters: Key Challenges After Top Court Order
content: The Supreme Court's order to civic bodies in Delhi-NCR to relocate all stray dogs living in residential neighbourhoods to shelters has sparked a massive debate

title: Air India Flight Diverted: 5 Parliamentarians Allege 'Breach Of Privilege'
content: Five MPs, including KC Venugopal of the Congress, wrote to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla over the incident of a Thiruvananthapuram-Delhi flight they were travelling in being diverted to Chennai and demanded action on alleged "breach of privilege".

title: BJP vs BJP Raises Delhi Club Poll Stakes, Amit Shah, Sonia Gandhi Turn Up
content: The election for a top post in the Constitutional Club of India turned into a star-studded affair this afternoon, thanks to an exciting BJP vs BJP contest. Union Home Minister Amit Shah, his minister colleagues Piyush Goyal and Kiren Rijiju, Congress

title: "Bring Your Light To The Children": Madonna's Appeal To Pope Over Gaza
content: Madonna has urged the pope to travel to Gaza and "bring your light to the children before it's too late."

title: 'Farm Babe' vs 'Food Babe' In Lopsided US Health Influencer Battle
content: Michelle Miller stands in a field of corn, stalks stretching above her perfectly styled hair, holding a tiny microphone and addressing an audience online.

title: Jharkhand Girl Gang-Raped While On Way To Catch Train, 2 Arrested
content: A 16-year-old minor girl was allegedly gang-raped while on her way to board a train in Jharkhand's Palamu district on Monday night.

title: Explained: Can Donald Trump Take Control Of Washington DC To Fight City's Crime
content: US President Donald Trump has repeatedly threatened to put Washington, DC, under full federal control to reduce crime, even as city officials stressed crime is already falling.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Asim Munir, And Why Trump Must Be A Little Careful With Flatterers
content: Trump's assessment of the US-Pakistan relations in his first presidential term was that of a parasitic arrangement. The volte-face in the current term has many reasons, the most important being Trump's proclivity for unabashed flatterers.

title: "When Paris Killed Dogs": Maneka Gandhi's History Lesson After Court Order
content: Maneka Gandhi warned of unintended consequences, adding that removing strays could create new problems.

title: Amidst Declining Trade Ties With India, Bangladesh Seeks New Partners
content: Bangladesh and Malaysia signed five memoranda of understanding (MoUs) and exchanged three notes in different areas of cooperation-- including defence, trade, and education-- on the first day of Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus's three-day visit

title: Vikram Sarabhai's Legacy Powers India's First Private Satellite Constellation
content: The Indian National Space Promotion and Authorisation Centre (IN-SPACe) has selected a PixxelSpace India-led consortium to build and operate the country's first fully indigenous commercial Earth Observation (EO) satellite constellation.

title: MLA Denied Ministerial Post Promised Before Polls: Telangana Deputy Chief Minister
content: A political can of worms is out in the open in the Telangana Congress after Deputy Chief Minister Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka, in a local TV interview, commented on Munugode MLA Komatireddy Rajagopal Reddy being denied a ministerial position.

title: Mumbai Boy Dies During Dahi Handi Practice
content: An 11-year-old member of a Govinda squad died after he fell during a practice session to form a human pyramid for the upcoming Dahi Handi festival in Mumbai.

title: Possessing Aadhaar, Voter ID Doesn't Make One Indian Citizen: Bombay High Court
content: A person does not become a citizen of India merely by possessing documents like Aadhaar card, PAN card or a voter ID, the Bombay High Court on Tuesday said while refusing bail to a man, allegedly from Bangladesh, for entering India illegally.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Delhi Has Zero State-Run Shelters. How Will It House 10 Lakh Stray Dogs?
content: It is not enough for the court to merely pass an order to make the streets of Delhi-NCR free of stray dogs. Indeed, the ruling will be meaningful only if the court takes all factors into account and exercises oversight every step of the way.

title: Aadhaar 'not conclusive proof': SC backs EC in Bihar SIR; Sibal alleges ID rejection
content: The Supreme Court is currently reviewing petitions challenging the Election Commission's decision to conduct a Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar. Allegations of discrepancies, such as inaccuracies in voter status, have been raised by petitioners.

title: Pakistan urges for water amid nuclear threats; asks India to resume normal functioning of IWT
content: The request came after Pakistan’s army chief, Asim Munir, issued a nuclear war warning and former foreign minister Bilawal Bhutto made statements calling for action over India’s position on the water-sharing agreement.

title: DGCA issues show-cause notice to IndiGo over simulator training lapses for 1,700 pilots
content: The DGCA has issued a show cause notice to IndiGo regarding alleged lapses in simulator training for approximately 1,700 pilots. The regulator found that IndiGo conducted critical airfield training on simulators unqualified for high-risk airports like Calicut, Leh, and Kathmandu. IndiGo is reviewing the notice and has committed to upholding the highest safety and compliance standards.

title: After 11 years, MS Dhoni's Rs 100-crore defamation case to finally go to trial
content: Mahendra Singh Dhoni's decade-old defamation case is finally heading to trial, as the Madras High Court has ordered proceedings to begin. Dhoni filed a Rs 100 crore suit against Zee Media and others, accusing them of falsely linking him to the IPL betting scandal. He will be available for examination, seeking to clear his name from baseless allegations.

title: OpenAI’s ‘warning shot’ at Indian IT: Analyst says it could hit revenue model
content: OpenAI's GPT-5 launch poses a threat to India's IT sector, potentially causing a 2-3% revenue decline due to enhanced AI coding capabilities. While AI improves productivity and shifts billing models, firms face challenges adapting to outcome-based pricing. Experts predict short-term pain but long-term gains as new AI opportunities emerge, requiring IT firms to overhaul delivery models.

title: Big 'Make in India' push! Cabinet approves four new semiconductor projects - details
content: The Union Cabinet has approved four new semiconductor projects under the India Semiconductor Mission, boosting the nation's ecosystem. These projects, with an investment of Rs 4,600 crore, include India's first commercial compound fabrication facility and an advanced glass-based substrate packaging unit.

title: 'No coercive action': Big SC relief for owners of old vehicles; issues notice
content: The Supreme Court has provided temporary relief to owners of older vehicles in Delhi-NCR. An interim order protects owners of diesel vehicles over 10 years old and petrol vehicles over 15 years old from coercive action.

title: Record-breaker! Brevis shatters multiple T20I milestones in one match
content: Dewald Brevis, the Chennai Super Kings batsman, exploded with an unbeaten 125 off 56 balls against Australia in the second T20I at Marrara Cricket Ground. His record-breaking innings, featuring 12 fours and eight sixes, propelled South Africa to their highest T20I total against Australia, 218 for seven. Brevis's century, reached in just 41 balls, is the second-fastest for South Africa.

title: Intel issues statement on CEO's meeting with Trump after he asked for his resignation
content: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan met President Trump after criticism over China ties. Intel issued a statement affirming commitment to US technology leadership. Trump described the meeting as "very interesting." Discussions will continue next week. This follows concerns raised about Tan's past business relationships. Intel seeks to protect federal funding for domestic manufacturing. Tan assumed Intel's leadership in March.

title: Devil lies in action: Why injury-prone Bumrah's workload management is crucial
content: Since his 2018 Test debut, Jasprit Bumrah’s career has been plagued by recurring back injuries, beginning with a stress fracture in 2019. The problem resurfaced in 2022, forcing multiple long layoffs, surgery in 2023, and missed major tournaments. Earlier this year, back spasms sidelined him again, underlining the persistent toll his unique bowling action takes on his body.

title: Sports Bill will end stagnation; bring in transparency: PT Usha
content: P T Usha, President of the Indian Olympic Association, strongly supports the National Sports Governance Bill, emphasizing its potential to revolutionize Indian sports administration by introducing transparency and accountability. Usha highlighted the bill's key provisions, including the establishment of a National Sports Board and a National Sports Tribunal.

title: 125* in 56 balls! 'Baby AB' Brevis steals the show during T20I - Watch
content: Dewald Brevis, also known as 'Baby AB', showcased an amazing performance in the second T20I. He scored an unbeaten 125 off 56 balls against Australia. This helped South Africa reach 218/7. Brevis's innings included a variety of shots. He is also a leg-spinner. He dreams of playing for Royal Challengers Bangalore with Virat Kohli in the IPL.

title: Apple iPhone 17 series: Higher prices expected; new leak claims why
content: Apple's iPhone 17 may see a price increase. Tariffs and potential storage upgrades are factors. The Pro model might start at 256GB. US tariffs on China and India could raise prices by $50 to $100. The iPhone 17 lineup is expected on September 9, 2025. These changes could affect global pricing strategies. Buyers are watching closely.

title: 'If we are going down ...': Pakistan threatens to target RIL’s Jamnagar refinery
content: Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, sparked controversy during his US visit by making anti-India remarks, including a threat to target Reliance's Jamnagar refinery. India strongly condemned Munir's "nuclear sabre-rattling" and questioned the safety of Pakistan's nuclear arsenal. Despite Pakistan's threats, India's military strength surpasses Pakistan's, with a larger active military and a growing nuclear arsenal.

title: Retail inflation plunges! July 2025 CPI at 8-year low; food inflation slips to -1.76%
content: Retail inflation has plummeted to a notable 1.55% in July 2025, marking an eight-year low since June 2017. A significant drop in food prices, with the Consumer Food Price Index at -1.76%, contributed to this decline.

title: 'They call it a menace, we call it a heartbeat': Ritika on stray dogs directive
content: Ritika Sajdeh, wife of Rohit Sharma, has voiced her concerns over the Supreme Court's directive to relocate stray dogs in Delhi-NCR to shelters. She advocated for humane solutions like sterilisation and vaccination programs instead of caging the animals. The court's order mandates immediate capture and relocation, with strict measures against obstruction, aiming to create stray dog-free localities.

title: 'Vote chori' row: Thousands protest KN Rajanna’s removal from cabinet
content: KN Rajanna was removed from his cabinet post. This followed his criticism of Rahul Gandhi. Supporters protested across Karnataka. One person reportedly attempted self-immolation. Siddaramaiah removed Rajanna after Congress high command directive. DK Shivakumar raised concerns about Rajanna's statements. Rajanna questioned Rahul Gandhi's vote theft allegations. BJP MLA R Ashoka commented on the situation.

title: Team India Test captain Gill named the ICC men's POTM for July 2025
content: Shubman Gill has been crowned ICC Men's Player of the Month for July 2025 following his stellar performance in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. As India's Test captain, Gill amassed 567 runs at an impressive average of 94.50, including a double century and two centuries. His remarkable Edgbaston innings featured a match total of 430 runs, contributing significantly to India's historic victory.

title: Travis Kelce’s 13th NFL season: Fans blame Taylor Swift
content: Taylor Swift revealed her upcoming 12th album, 'The Life of a Showgirl,' on the New Heights podcast hosted by the Kelce brothers. The announcement, shared in a video clip, sparked excitement among Swifties and concern from some football fans regarding Travis Kelce's career. Jason Kelce's changed hair color also grabbed attention, diverting from the album news.

title: 'Ram was out of his mind': Tamil poet Vairamuthi's remarks sparks row
content: Lyricist Vairamuthu's recent remarks on Lord Ram, claiming he was 'out of his mind' after separating from Sita, have ignited controversy in Tamil Nadu. Vairamuthu's comments, made at a Kambar Kazhagam event, drew sharp criticism from TN BJP President Nainar Nagenthran, who deemed them 'anti-Hindu'.

title: Fatehpur mausoleum row: SP expels Pappu Chauhan for 'anti-party activities'
content: Pappu Singh Chauhan, a Samajwadi Party leader, was expelled for engaging in "anti-party" activities following an FIR against him and others for attempting to vandalize a 200-year-old mausoleum in Fatehpur. Hindu right-wing members, claiming the site as a temple, created a disturbance.

title: Rohit Sharma tests speed of his most expensive car, fans go wild - WATCH
content: Indian cricket star Rohit Sharma recently added a striking red Lamborghini Urus SE to his impressive car collection. He was spotted driving the luxury SUV in Mumbai, attracting attention from fans. The personalised number plate, 3015, cleverly combines his children's birthdays and his iconic jersey number, 45.

title: MS Dhoni's secret to staying cool: 'Like a tin roof ... '
content: Ambati Rayudu shared an anecdote about MS Dhoni's leadership at CSK, recalling how Dhoni cautioned him against losing his cool and arguing with umpires to avoid Fair Play point deductions. Ironically, Rayudu revealed that Dhoni himself once stepped onto the field during a tense match when CSK was facing defeat.

title: New I-T Bill 2025: Income Tax Act 1961 to be replaced; what taxpayers should know
content: New Income Tax Bill 2025: The Parliament has passed the New Income Tax Bill 2025, a major overhaul aimed at simplifying tax procedures for individuals and corporations. The revised bill, incorporating recommendations from a Parliamentary Select Committee, reduces text volume, streamlines the taxation timeline, and clarifies provisions for refunds and deductions.

title: 'Public safety, animal welfare go hand in hand': Rahul on SC's stray dog order
content: Rahul Gandhi opposed the Supreme Court's order on relocating stray dogs. He called it a step back from humane policies. The court directed that Delhi-NCR localities should be free of stray dogs. It also ordered no captured dogs to be released back. The court warned against obstructing the capture drive. Police detained animal rights activists protesting the decision at India Gate.

title: 'Don't buy Hamas numbers': Israeli envoy to Priyanka on 'murder' of journalists
content: Israel's Ambassador to India, Reuven Azar, strongly criticised Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra for her condemnation of the Israeli strike that killed Al Jazeera journalists, labeling her remarks as deceitful. Azar defended Israel's actions, stating they targeted Hamas terrorists and accused the group of using civilians as shields. Gandhi Vadra had accused Israel of committing genocide and criticized the Indian government's silence on the matter.

title: Gurgaon techie who flashed woman arrested; was returning from son's PTM
content: In a troubling incident, the Gurgaon police have taken into custody Abhilash Kumar, a 32-year-old MTech graduate, for allegedly harassing a woman at Rajiv Chowk on August 2nd. The assistant manager, hailing from Karnal, was arrested in Sector 49 after a meticulous investigation that included reviewing CCTV footage.

title: 'Process of removal should begin': Panel formed to probe Justice Varma cash row
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has formed a three-member committee to probe allegations against Justice Yashwant Varma related to a “cash-at-home” controversy. The panel includes senior advocate P.V. Acharya, Justice Aravind Kumar of the Supreme Court, and Madras High Court Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava.

title: Taylor Swift and Sabrina Carpenter’s surprise collab: NFL fans go wild
content: Pop sensation Taylor Swift is set to release her new album, 'The Life of a Showgirl'. The album announcement was hinted at during Travis Kelce's podcast. A collaboration with Sabrina Carpenter is also in the works. Fans are eagerly awaiting Swift's full appearance on 'New Heights'. The album release is strategically timed with the NFL preseason.

title: ‘Husband’s sperm count too low’: Father-in-law, relative rape Gujarat woman
content: A Vadodara woman filed a police report. She accused her father-in-law and sister-in-law's husband of repeated rape. The motive was to impregnate her due to her husband's low sperm count. She also accused her husband of blackmail after a miscarriage. The incidents occurred between February and July 2024. Police have registered a First Information Report and are investigating the case.

title: Grok suspended over Gaza comments? Musk calls it ‘dumb error’
content: Elon Musk's AI chatbot, Grok, faced a brief suspension from X, sparking controversy after it attributed the removal to comments about Israel's actions in Gaza, citing ICJ rulings and UN reports. Musk dismissed this, attributing the suspension to a "dumb error.

title: Uttarakhand flash flood aftermath: Temporary lake formed in Harsil poses new risk
content: A temporary lake near Harsil, formed after the Dharali flash flood, poses a threat to downstream areas. Authorities are working to drain the lake safely. Geologists are assessing the lake's stability. SDRF personnel are clearing obstructions. The Army is overseeing operations. Road restoration is hampered by the lake and ongoing rain. NDMA has ordered constant surveillance and safe water release.

title: How much will Ronaldo have to pay if he splits with Georgina Rodriguez?
content: Georgina Rodríguez, now engaged to Cristiano Ronaldo, has amassed a $10 million fortune through modelling, reality TV, and entrepreneurial ventures. Their engagement was announced on August 11 on Instagram. While Ronaldo boasts a billion-dollar net worth, safeguards are reportedly in place: Rodríguez would receive a substantial monthly pension and Ronaldo's Madrid mansion if they separate.

title: ‘Unscientific and inhumane': Activists say SC order goes against govt's 2023 rule
content: Animal welfare activists are up in arms against a recent Supreme Court order mandating the relocation of stray dogs, citing violations of the Animal Birth Control Rules, 2023. They emphasize the absence of government-run dog shelters in Delhi-NCR and the impracticality of mass relocation without proper census data.

title: 'Don't want you to be comfortable': Did Trump just roast the press? Watch video
content: President Trump, during a press conference announcing the federalization of Washington, DC, dismissed a reporter's request for a larger press briefing room, jokingly stating he didn't want the press to be comfortable. This remark drew laughter from officials and reporters present. Trump also declared "Liberation Day in DC," vowing to eliminate crime and improve the capital.

title: Woman injured in tree fall dies after ambulance stuck for hours on pothole-ridden NH-48
content: Chhaaya Purav, 49, tragically died after a tree fell on her at her former school in Palghar. While being transported to a Mumbai hospital, the ambulance became trapped in a severe traffic jam on the pothole-filled Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway. The delay exacerbated her injuries, and she was pronounced dead upon arrival at a closer hospital.

title: Nasa teases major discovery: Mystery object speeds through solar system
content: NASA has shared new details about 3I/ATLAS. It is an interstellar object moving at 209,000 km/h. Hubble images show it is smaller than thought, about 5.6 km wide. It is a comet with a glowing tail. Scientists estimate it is eight billion years old. It poses no threat to Earth. NASA uses telescopes to study it.

title: Weed behind bars: Ganja-filled ball thrown into Maharashtra jail
content: A security lapse at Beed district prison led to a violent clash among four undertrial prisoners after an unidentified person threw a rubber ball filled with ganja into the facility. The inmates fought over the distribution of the contraband, prompting jail staff intervention and a police investigation.

title: Nitish Katara murder case: SC rules no jail beyond fixed term
content: The Supreme Court of India has mandated the immediate release of convicts across all states and union territories who have completed their court-mandated sentences, provided they are not implicated in other cases. This directive follows the court's concern about prisoners being detained beyond their sentence terms. The order was issued during the case of Sukhdev Yadav, convicted in the Nitish Katara murder, who finished his 20-year sentence in March.

title: How Indian cities tackle stray dog issue; Netherlands ended it with 'benchmark model'
content: The Supreme Court has mandated the removal of stray dogs in Delhi-NCR, directing their confinement to shelters. Various Indian cities employ different strategies, including sterilization programs, designated feeding zones, and compensation for bite victims. The Netherlands eradicated its stray dog issue through comprehensive measures like sterilization, strict animal welfare laws, and promoting adoption.

title: Fresh trouble for Nayara Energy: SBI stops trade & forex transactions
content: State Bank of India has ceased trade and foreign currency dealings with Nayara Energy due to potential US sanctions, prioritizing compliance with international rules. This decision, made after recent US tariff hikes and EU sanctions, impacts Nayara's international transactions. Nayara is now seeking alternative arrangements with domestic institutions like UCO Bank to navigate these challenges.

title: Who is Georgina Rodriguez? Cristiano Ronaldo’s fiancée
content: Cristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodriguez have announced their engagement after eight years together, Rodriguez shared the news on Instagram, showcasing a diamond ring. Their relationship began in 2016, and they share a blended family, including five children. Rodriguez, a model and influencer, stars in her own Netflix series, 'I Am Georgina'. The engagement marks a significant milestone in their journey.

title: ED faces 'wall of the dead' as Vadra puts burden on deceased colleagues
content: Robert Vadra, facing an Enforcement Directorate probe into land deals, has attributed key financial decisions to deceased associates, including Rajesh Khurana and H.L. Pahwa. This strategy mirrors responses from Sonia and Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case, where they cited the late Motilal Vora's knowledge. The ED alleges Vadra was evasive and suppressed information regarding transactions.

title: Karnataka rains: Water enters Saundatti Yallamma temple in Belagavi district, hundi submerged
content: Bank notes were kept in the open all around the temple to dry. All the bank notes were covered in saffron and vermilion

title: Pune varsity withdraws 'Voice of Devendra' competition notice after objection from NSUI
content: The university's National Social Scheme wing had uploaded a notification on its website to take part in the elocution competition organised under the title "Voice of Devendra", taking inspiration from Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis.

title: John Abraham writes to CJI, calls for review of Supreme Court’s directive on stray dogs
content: The letter came a day after the Supreme Court directed the authorities to permanently relocate all strays from streets to shelters “at the earliest”

title: Drone entrepreneurship programme for Ex-servicemen launched
content: As part of the entrepreneurship development programme Dhaksha Drones will provide drones to the ex-servicemen after imparting training to the beneficiaries

title: Parliamentary proceedings: Raising FDI limit for insurers to 100% will generate employment opportunities, says FM Sitharaman
content: The Insurance Act, 1938 governs investment by insurers with a strong emphasis on safety, liquidity, and regulatory oversight by aligning investment by insurers with policyholder interests

title: Catholic Congress slams CPI(M) Kerala secretary M.V. Govindan’s remarks on Archbishop Joseph Pamplany
content: Father Kaviyil Philip, global director of Catholic Congress, says Govindan ‘should not speak like Govindachamy’

title: Union Cabinet approves four new semiconductor projects worth ₹4,594 crore
content: The Union Minister said “The six projects that were previously approved have a capacity of producing 24 billion chips annually”

title: TDP MPs, MLAs urge HM Amit Shah to renew FCRA of RDT
content: The TDP delegation appraised Mr. Amit Shah about the service activities of the RDT and how the activities have brought a change in the life of the people of the region over the last five decades

title: DMK government’s rush to implement welfare schemes before polls reflects its fear of defeat: Nainar Nagenthran
content: Speaking to the media in Chennai, Mr. Nagenthran alleged that murders have become a daily occurence in Tamil Nadu under the DMK rule

title: Uttarkashi flash floods: NGRI experts launch search operation to trace 66 missing in disaster-hit Dharali
content: NGRI experts use Ground Penetrating Radars to locate missing people in Uttarkashi flood disaster, with rescue operations ongoing

title: BJP MP petitions ECI on C.M. Ibrahim’s claim of helping Siddaramaiah win 2018 Assembly poll in Badami by ‘buying’ 3,000 votes
content: Pointing out that Siddaramaiah won the election by a narrow margin of 1,696 votes, BJP MP Lahar Singh described Ibrahim’s claims of ‘vote purchase’ as an ‘alleged electoral crime’

title: Owaisi condemns Pakistan Army chief Asim Munir’s remarks, demands political response from Modi government
content: Asaduddin Owaisi said India being a strategic partner, this misuse of American soil is unacceptable to India and Indians; he demanded Centre raise the issue strongly with the U.S.

title: No plans to declare cow national animal: Centre tells Parliament
content: “No, Sir. As per Article 246(3) of the Constitution, under the distribution of legislative powers between the Union and the States, the preservation of animals is a matter on which the State legislature has exclusive powers to legislate,” Union Minister S.P. Singh Baghel said in a written reply to Parliament

title: Watch: Elector deletions after SIR in Bihar: Many problematic questions emerge: Data Point
content: In this video, The Hindu Data Team unpacks the district-level data, charts key trends, and explores these key trends that emerge from the analysis

title: Parliamentary panel on simultaneous elections gets extension till last week of winter session
content: According to the motion, the panel has been given time till up to the first day of last week of the Winter session, 2025, to present its report.

title: CM Stalin launches Thayumanavar scheme in T.N. to deliver ration products at doorsteps of elderly, disabled people
content: Essential commodities from ration shops would be delivered at the doorsteps of the beneficiaries on the second Saturday and Sunday of every month.

title: Withdrawal of Punjab land pooling policy victory of farmers, labourers: BJP
content: ‘They (Delhi-based AAP leaders) brought the land pooling policy to loot Punjab,’ says Punjab BJP leader Ashwani Sharma

title: Congress in Kerala lodges police complaint against Union Minister Suresh Gopi, alleges electoral fraud
content: Former Thrissur MP T.N. Prathapan files complaint seeking criminal probe against Suresh Gopi on charge of filing false affidavit claiming more than six months’ domicile in the Lok Sabha constituency ahead of filing nomination in 2024 polls

title: Assam to have 10 new co-districts
content: The initiative aims to bring essential services closer to citizens, improve administrative efficiency and strengthen the delivery of public welfare, the CMO said in a post

title: BJP MP C. Sadanandan, CPI(M) leader M.V. Jayarajan trade barbs
content: Sadanandan writes in a Facebook post that the CPI(M) leader’s ‘army’ will not be enough to prevent the former’s political rise. Jayarajan earlier likened Sadanandan to Pragya Singh Thakur

title: Supreme Court’s directive on stray dogs a step back from humane, science-backed policy: Rahul
content: “Shelters, sterilisation, vaccination & community care can keep streets safe - without cruelty. Blanket removals are cruel, shortsighted, and strip us of compassion,” Rahul Gandhi said

title: Schoolgirl 'gang-raped' in Odisha, relative among five detained
content: The relative of the minor told her to visit a temple in the nearby village, but had taken her to the crime site, police said

title: In Bihar’s Begusarai, Congress submits list of 37 deceased electors in the draft list for one polling booth
content: Such anomalies in the draft list of voters are present at every booth in every Assembly constituency, the CPI MLA of the Teghra Assembly constituency, where the issue has been raised, said

title: Lok Sabha Speaker sets in motion the process to remove Allahabad High Court Justice Yashwant Varma
content: The three-member committee includes Justice Arvind Kumar of the Supreme Court, Justice Manindra Mohan Srivastava, Chief Justice of the Madras High Court and Senior Advocate of Karnataka High Court B.V. Acharya

title: Priyanka Gandhi slams Indian govt for ‘silence’ on ‘Israel committing genocide’; Envoy hits back
content: Priyanka Gandhi said the "cold blooded murder" of five Al Jazeera journalists is another heinous crime committed on Palestinian soil

title: War of words breaks out between CPI(M), Church leadership in Kerala over ‘Sangh Parivar affinity’
content: Row centres around CPI(M)‘s accusations that certain bishops show a predilection towards Modi and Shah, while ‘turning a blind eye to attacks’ against Christians and clergy by Hindu right-wing organisations in BJP-ruled States

title: Sports Bill will result in extreme centralisation of sports administration, says Congress
content: Jairam Ramesh alleged that the BCCI will get the most favoured treatment, not subject to any laws of the land like the RTI

title: Guntur to host a 10-Km national flag display in ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ programme
content: GMC Commissioner says the initiative will instil patriotism among citizens and remind the youth and students of India’s freedom struggle, and urges everyone to take part in the historic display

title: Pilots’ union urges DGCA to withdraw notice period proposal before global body
content: The pilot’s body says that implementing a notice period risks turning aviation personnel into bonded labourers in a duopoly

title: Body of man accused of killing his sisters found in river in Kerala’s Kannur
content: Police say Pramod had been caring for his sisters, both of whom suffered from health issues, and is believed to have killed them when he could no longer continue doing so

title: Bhubaneswar-based CIFA to lead multi-country effort to improve livelihood of aquaculture farmers
content: The project will directly benefit over 1,20,000 rural households, 30% of which comprise women, across Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Nepal and Sri Lanka, says CIFA

title: NLCIL signs MoU with Bhabha Atomic Research Centre for extraction of rare earth elements from fly ash
content: According to NLCIL, under this agreement, a pilot project will be established at Neyveli with technical support from BARC to demonstrate the process of extracting rare earth elements from fly ash, a by-product of thermal power generation

title: Naveen Patnaik expresses concerns over disturbing pattern of girls’ suicides in Odisha
content: Congress forms three fact-finding teams to look into incidences of rape, sexual harassment and suicide in Balasore, Nabarangpur, and Bargarh dists

title: Kerala moves Supreme Court against Governor’s appointment of interim Vice-Chancellor to APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University
content: The Chancellor appointed Dr. K. Sivaprasad solely according to his choice and not based on the recommendation of the Government, contends Kerala

title: India monsoon rains highlights: Heavy rains lash Jammu region, schools shut in Rajouri, Reasi, Poonch districts
content: Uttarkashi rescue operations affected due to incessant rainfall; Dehradun administrations declares leave for schools after heavy rains; Kedarnath Yatra remains suspended due to rains

title: Overnight downpour drenches Telangana, Warangal’s Kapulakanaparthy records 21.8 cm rain
content: According to data from the Telangana Development Planning Society (TGDPS), between 8.30 a.m. of August 11 and 8 a.m. of August 12, Kapulakanaparthy in Warangal district recorded the highest rainfall of 21.8 cm.

title: Musi River overflow shuts Chaderghat causeway; Hyderabad traffic police suggests alternative routes
content: Authorities said the closure of  Chaderghat causeway was necessary after heavy rains caused a surge in the river’s flow, making the causeway unsafe for travel

title: Ranking the top 50 players in baseball right now: MLB Rank 2025 in-season update
content: We asked ESPN MLB experts to give an updated top-50 ranking, allowing us to take stock of the best performances of the 2025 season so far.

title: MLB Rank update: What we got right -- and very wrong -- on both of this season's lists
content: Who is still too low in our update? Who did we miss in our initial list? Our best -- and worst -- rankings revisited.

title: Sources: Alabama names Simpson starting QB
content: Alabama players were informed that Ty Simpson would be the team's starting quarterback on Monday, sources said.

title: Gruden wins key Nevada ruling in NFL emails suit
content: The Nevada Supreme Court on Monday sided with former Las Vegas Raiders coach Jon Gruden in his lawsuit alleging the NFL leaked damaging emails to the media before he resigned from the team in 2021.

title: Spaun, Schauffele nail down U.S. Ryder Cup spots
content: U.S. Open winner J.J. Spaun and two-time major champion Xander Schauffele will join world No. 1 golfer Scottie Scheffler on the U.S. team when it takes on Europe in next month's Ryder Cup.

title: Brewers win 10 straight again; eye 'bigger goals'
content: The Milwaukee Brewers on Monday night became the first MLB team since 2019 with multiple winning streaks of 10 or more games.

title: Texas first No. 1 team to be underdog in Week 1
content: Texas took the top spot in the preseason AP Top 25 for the first time in program history but still enters Week 1 as an underdog vs. No. 3 Ohio State.

title: Steelers' Heyward hints at sitting out into season
content: Cam Heyward wants a raise, and the longtime Steelers defensive tackle indicated Monday he is open to sitting out regular-season games to get one.

title: Seles: 'Reset' after myasthenia gravis diagnosis
content: Monica Seles says she was diagnosed in 2022 with myasthenia gravis -- a neuromuscular autoimmune disease that causes weakness in voluntary muscles.

title: Browns' Garrett cited for going 100 mph in 60 zone
content: Browns defensive end Myles Garrett was issued a citation for speeding on the interstate in a Cleveland suburb early Saturday morning, according to court records, after he was clocked going 100 mph in a 60 mph zone.

title: 👀 Taylor Swift teases new album on Kelce pod
content: After a teaser post with a Taylor Swift-shaped silhouette fueled rumors, it was confirmed that the pop star will make her first appearance on the Kelce brothers' podcast.

title: Barnwell: How Jerry Jones' bungled contract negotiations cost the Cowboys $100 million
content: How much have the Cowboys cost themselves by being too slow to get contracts done with Parsons, Dak Prescott and CeeDee Lamb?

title: Thunder targeted? Cavs injuries? The under-the-radar concerns for each NBA contender

title: Where the NBA's biggest remaining free agents stand this offseason
content: The futures of Jonathan Kuminga, Josh Giddey and others remain in flux as the 2025-26 season draws closer.

title: Venmo requests and death threats: Heckling in the digital sports betting age

title: How Flick won his battle with Ter Stegen in Barça coach's riskiest move yet
content: Hansi Flick and Barcelona pushed things to the limit with injured captain Marc-André ter Stegen and won. Time will tell if the gambit was a true success.
